intro: Melampyrum cristatum subvar. ronnigeri, commonly known as the spiked touch-me-not, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescence and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
